1�Those Kuluu who survived the happenings of that day fled here. However, the power of the crystals left its mark on us. As time passed, our bodies and minds degenerated into the form you see standing before you.
1�We do not regret our actions.
1�It was a small sacrifice to save Vana'diel.
1�What will happen, happens. One can sit and ponder over what could have been, but that would only be a waste of time. We must move on.
1�This world belongs to all who reside on its fertile soil. We could not let it be transformed into a mere playground for the gods.
1�However, when I learned that Delkfutt's Tower remained unchanged even after the accident, I could sense that something was amiss.
1�At that moment, I knew our fight was not yet over.
1�Heed my words, young adventurer. Thou must travel to the small island of Zepwell, located to the southwest of Bastok. There thou wilt find the remains of an ancient temple.
1�There thou must join the eight fragments of light. Only then will the Dawnmaidens show thee the path thou must follow.
1�The fragments can be found embedded in eight stone monuments located in remote areas of Vana'diel. As to their precise whereabouts, that is for thee to discover.
1�My time has passed. There is nothing more I can do but stand back and watch as this drama unfolds.
1�Ah, yes. There is one more thing I must tell thee. Beware of the elder prince of the Zilart. The bond he has formed with the crystals is great. His magic is truly powerful.
1�He has already crossed the boundaries of man and stepped into the forbidden realm of the gods. Thou must be careful.
1�I will not pray for thy success, as it is not prayer that will lead thee to victory. Thou wilt do what thou must to overcome this great evil.
1�Here is the first fragment to start thee on thy journey.Now, be off! There is not much time.

1�Those Kuluu who survived the happenings of that day fled here. However, the power of the crystals left its mark on us. As time passed, our bodies and minds degenerated into the form you see standing before you.
1�We do not regret our actions.
1�It was a small sacrifice to save Vana'diel.
1�What will happen, happens. One can sit and ponder over what could have been, but that would only be a waste of time. We must move on.
1�This world belongs to all who reside on its fertile soil. We could not let it be transformed into a mere playground for the gods.
1�However, when I learned that Delkfutt's Tower remained unchanged even after the accident, I could sense that something was amiss.
1�At that moment, I knew our fight was not yet over.
1�Heed my words, young adventurer. Thou must travel to the small island of Zepwell, located to the southwest of Bastok. There thou wilt find the remains of an ancient temple.
1�There thou must join the eight fragments of light. Only then will the Dawnmaidens show thee the path thou must follow.
1�The fragments can be found embedded in eight stone monuments located in remote areas of Vana'diel. As to their precise whereabouts, that is for thee to discover.
1�My time has passed. There is nothing more I can do but stand back and watch as this drama unfolds.
1�Ah, yes. There is one more thing I must tell thee. Beware of the elder prince of the Zilart. The bond he has formed with the crystals is great. His magic is truly powerful.
1�He has already crossed the boundaries of man and stepped into the forbidden realm of the gods. Thou must be careful.
1�I will not pray for thy success, as it is not prayer that will lead thee to victory. Thou wilt do what thou must to overcome this great evil.
1�Here is the first fragment to start thee on thy journey.Now, be off! There is not much time.
1�Ah, but thou dost desire to learn more?
1�Then pray come to my facility.1��
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.The Temple of Uggalepih(pt.1).The Temple of Uggalepih(pt.2).The Temple of Uggalepih(pt.3).The Temple of Uggalepih(pt.4).Project: Shantottofication.An Uneasy Peace.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
1�The crystals' copious power feeds your curse without cease.
1�Our custom-made curse in its fully charged statewill unleash upon Vana'diel an irreversible fate.
1�Every creature alive will be delighted to takethe luscious form of yours truly, even if they are fake.
1�And then a perfect world order shall arise:One that exists solely for our pleasure, all the way to the skies!
1�Impertinence in men makes our hackles rise.You have earned yourself an unpleasant surprise.
1�Death by cane...
1�You decide which one is worse!O?`hohohohoho!
e!�The curse has been unleashed and now wreaks havoc on the land.There are few things that we consider more grand!
1�In a matter of moments, Vana'diel will be ours to rule.Your efforts were in vain, don't you feel like a fool?
o!�O?`hohohohoho!
1�Where do you intend to have us go?At the very least, we demand to know.
1�Very well, you have our leave to do what must be done.
1�For whom the highroad ends is not for you to decide.We shall emerge triumphant; you have picked the wrong side.
1�The curse's potency has reached its peak.The whole lot of you will soon be up the creek.
1�The crystals' copious power feeds your curse without cease.
1�Make no mistake, this bird is ripe for release.
1�And the Holy Shantotto Empire shall shine forever more.If it's not to your taste, we'll gladly show you the door.
1�Ah, the young upstart who knows not when enough is enough.Turn around and leave, or we'll be forced to play rough.
1�Calm of temperament though I might appear to be,if pushed over the edge, it will be red that I see.
1�...or death by curse?
1�The last laugh shall be ours to cherish.And the last thing you hear before you all perish.
1�Let me remind you now, never once did I claimto ever have been of original fame.
1�To alleviate further confusion,I offer you this solution.
1�From this moment on, please call me ??Belle Shantotto.??An inspired name befitting of its owner! O?`hohohohoho!
1�Loath as I am to be merged with her,it is to your decision that I defer.
1�Apologies all around for having arrived fashionably late.But as the saying goes: good things come to those who wait!
1�The true Shantotto of this world, to be precise.But the details can wait, I have a curse to excise.
1�Yoran-Oran, you're clearly misled.Allow me to explain what really happened instead.
1�The experiments I conducted were for a potent new spell,which allows inter-dimensional travel--now that's a scroll that should sell.
1�Oh, my skeptical colleague, will you never, ever learn???Impossible?? isn't in my dictionary, no matter how many pages you turn.
1�Now, to make a long story worthy of being sung,to an alternate Vana'diel I was forcefully flung.
1�With a dearth of things to do over there,I tried my hand at building an empire fair.
1�Alas, the empire was robbed of a chance to reach the height of glory.For its empress-to-be was ousted--uh...never mind that story.
1�I'd venture that these extraneous two were transported to this planeat the exact same time I found myself wandering in their domain.
1�For them, however, the shock of impact proved too much to bear.The result is what you see before you; remember it's rude to stare!
1�The probable cause, though this be merely supposition,is that splitting in two is a predisposition.
1�Another theory suggests that my resilient strength of mindreduced my chance of being sundered where lesser beings would feel the grind.
1�Although the details have yet to be fully revealed to me,that my counterparts were up to mischief is plain enough to see.
1�But now that I've made my triumphant return,the world can be at ease; stomachs need no longer churn.
1�But what is this? An inner voice that echoes from withinfills my mind with wicked thoughts and urges me to sin.
1�Should we three Shantottos come together and form a team,nothing could withstand us--an empire would not be a dream!
1�Humorless Aldo, dear, I was speaking in jest.The worst of it is over, you can soon get some rest.
1�To accommodate her and me and you,a single dimension just won't do.
1�And returning to the dimension whence you cameis the only way to be whole again: one and the same.
1�I would rather not be held responsiblefor tearing the fabric of time--a crime unforgivable.
1�So unless a kindly soul would volunteer to take the fall,the two of you are bound for home; this is the final call.
n!�Now that balance has been restored,I cannot help but feel a tad bored.
1�As a member of academia, Yoran-Oran, you should be fully aware:advancements in magic and risks are inseparable; this fact I bring to bear.
1�Just this once, though, I'll concede the possibilitythat inter-dimensional travel could become a liability.
1�And that the cons outweigh the prosand might give birth to a host of woes.
1�I shall swallow my pride and seal the beast,and forgo my dreams of being toast of the feast.
1�I make this sacrifice for the peace and prosperityof a fair and beauteous Vana'diel, and its posterity!
e!�Don't even think about releasing that curse into the world!
f.�Wh-what in the name of Altana!?Do...do my eyes play tricks!?
1�Y-yet another Doctor Shantotto!?
1�The curse...has it been neutralized?
1�What!? Is there no end to this madness!?
1�So this nightmare is over at long last...
1�True enough, but there's a limit to everything, you know.
1�She's, um...gone.
1�Cheer up, Professor.After all, the world is safe again, thanks to our efforts.
1�So let's let bygones be bygones. What do you say, hm?
1�With time, even a headstrong woman like Doctor Shantotto should mellow down and perhaps even become a model citizen.
1�Now, now, Professor, any peace-loving person who calls Vana'diel home would've done the same thing.
1�Whoa, go easy on the formalities there, Professor!After all, what we did, we didn't do to get pats on the back.
1�Just the knowledge that the world is no longer imperiled is reward enough. Isn't that right,  ?
n!�Well, well, doctors.Looks like it's the end of the highroad for the two of you.
1�What are you--!?
1�I believe so...and just in the nick of time-ethy.
1�But one very big question-ethy still remains.If this is the real Doctor Shantotto who stands before us now, who--or what--is the other one-ethy?
1�But...how is this possible-ethy?All this time, I was convinced that a failed teleportation experiment-ethy had split you into two!
1�Inter-dimensional travel, you say!?B-but that's theoretically-ethy impossible!
1�If I might make-ethy a comment, Doctor, jests don't exactly become-ethy you...
1�Not so fast-ethy, Doctor.
1�The domain-ethy of magic you meddled in this time is hazardous beyond mortal comprehension-ethy.The world as we know it could have been damned for eternity-ethy!
1�A-ahem! Doctor, you make it sound-ethy as though you're the solution rather than the root of the problem-ethy...
1�Now, I trust you won't object-ethy to claiming responsi--
1�Wh-what!?<Sigh>... What am I to do-ethy with her?
t?�We can only hope-ethy, Aldo. We can only hope-ethy...
1�But to think-ethy how close the world came to the brink-ethy of being unraveled...Had you and   not intervened, none-ethy of us would be standing here at this moment-ethy.
1�No, there's no need for modesty-ethy.It's to you two that the world-ethy owes its survival.
1�Aldo,  . On behalf-ethy of the nation of Windurst and its citizens, I offer you my heartfelt-ethy thanks.
1�Ohoho...ho...areeno?What in the world-aroo was I just do-diddley-oodling?
1�Deep beneath Vana'diel rest five enormous crystals, all more powerful than any force on this planet. The Zilart used that power to develop their civilization.
1�The five arks, also known as crags, tap the crystals of their power...
1�The Crystal Lines tie the arks...And Delkfutt's Tower controls the flow of energy...
1�However, this was only the beginning. They had other plans for the power of the crystals.
1�The Gate of the Gods...It is said that bringing the power of the five crystals together will open the gate to the heavens and transform Vana'diel into a paradise for the gods.

1�However, we Kuluu, along with the followers of the Goddess, the Dawnmaidens, were against this plan. We voiced our disapproval to the Zilart, but they were too driven by their self-centered motives to lend an ear to our pleas.
1�The Gate of the Gods--the floating island of Tu'Lia--was constructed, and the Zilart's plan was put into motion.

1�A fantastic amount of energy was drained from the crystals and focused into Tu'Lia. However, while this was taking place, we Kuluu led an attack on the northernmost ark and destroyed it, putting an end to their abominable plan.
1�Unfortunately, this act caused the crystals to spin out of control. The world was engulfed in a blinding light, and the Zilart were destroyed.
1�The land where the Zilart resided sank to the abyssal depths of the sea, while the overwhelming power of the crystals laid waste to the Northlands, leaving them uninhabitable.
